attachments.text: The Google Play Developer Console provides several tools that help you test your In-app Billing implementation: To test In-app Billing in an application you must install the application on an Android-powered device. You cannot use the Android emulator…
attachments.fallback: The Google Play Developer Console provides several tools that help you test your In-app Billing implementation: To test In-app Billing in an application you must install the application on an Android-powered device. You cannot use the Android emulator…

text: In order to test In-app billing, we’ll have to release the app on alpha or beta distribution channels. this should be fine, but I’m not a huge fan

if there’s no other way then i guess that’s just what we have to do. if i’m correct, does this mean we need to reach out to them to release it in alpha or beta dist. channels? i will reach out right away if that’s the case
I think it’s something that I can set up through the google developer portal
the only people with access will be people on a whitelist, so it will not be publicly available
I’ll make sure to let you/them know before publishing it like that so they are aware what’s happening
right - read that in there. and thanks for letting me know that would be great
